comment: This defines the order in which modules load during pxOS boot

sequence.name: Pixel BIOS
sequence.description: Minimal bootstrap: verify integrity, mount PixelFS read-only, load kernel

sequence.name: Core Kernel
sequence.description: Memory layout, PixelFS R/W, syscalls, logging infrastructure

sequence.name: Safety/Policy Kernel
sequence.description: Refusal logic, rate limiting, allowed operations, safety constraints

sequence.name: LLM Control Plane
sequence.description: Discover PXDigest models, build routing table, high-level LLM APIs

sequence.name: World Substrate
sequence.description: Infinite map, coordinate system, entity registry, scheduling

sequence.name: System Shell (for LLMs)
sequence.description: Command language and API for LLM agents to control pxOS

sequence.name: Human Shell (chat + map)
sequence.description: Infinite map viewer, chat console, inspectors for humans

sequence.name: Pixel REPL
sequence.description: Interactive REPL where LLMs can propose and run pixel code

sequence.name: Guardian
sequence.description: Watchdog/monitor for runaway behavior and system health

notes: Stages 0-4 are required for a minimal boot
Stages 10+ are optional shells and tools
LLM-first design: safety and control plane before UI
Each module should be loadable via SYS_BLOB and have a PXIM header
